definition: to support/to bear (a weight)/to prop up
to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee

sentences.english: This Jovian moon isn't trying to give life the cold shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 这颗木星的卫星并不打算用它冰冷的肩膀来承托生命。

sentences.english: The clutch bell is supported by double bearings and has been made more durable.
sentences.chinese: 离合器钟是用双袖承承托的而且它的制造比较耐用。

sentences.english: Support force of the anchor plate.
It's holding back the water that's in the sky, and the word "heaven" refers to that thing.
sentences.chinese: 它承托着天上的水，“天“这个词就指的是那个东西。

definition: perfectly round/(fig.) accommodating/considerate/smooth (way of doing things)
line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
